g.text: In this study, oleic acid-capped CdSe/ZnS core
incorporated into an aliphatic acrylate polymer by the solution
mixing method, followed by photopolymerization. The small
amounts of QD clusters were uniformly dispersed in the
polymer matrix. The prepared nanocomposite consisted of 0.1
wt % of CdSe/ZnS QDs showing stable optical properties,
achieving high white LED performance of 7976 lm/m
30 mA working current. The light emission eﬃciency, CRI, and
the color temperature of 14%, 47, and 11 204 K, were obtained
at this current. Meanwhile, the incorporation of a small amount
of QDs improved the thermal stability of the polymer matrix.
These results are important for the practical application of
electroluminescent LED devices using the QD package.
Scheme 2. Sequence Reactions between TMSPMA with the Surface of Plasma-Treated PET Films
(I) The hydrolysis of trimethoxysilyl groups and (II) dehydrated condensation between Si
OH groups on the surface of the PET
